intro: Odontites alshehbazianus, commonly known as the Alshehbaz's toothed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves with toothed edges, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. Odontites alshehbazianus is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
